Detailed Description

Entering/leaving/utility video functions

char* enter_graphics ( int  mode,
__dpmi_meminfo *  map 
)

Enter graphics mode, enabling near pointers and mapping video physical memory to program virtual address.

Returns a generic pointer pointing to video memory address or NULL on error. "mode" specifies the VESA graphics mode to use, and the mapping information is returned through "map".

Also initializes two global variables, VRES and HRES,

int get_pixel ( int  x,
int  y,
char *  base 
)

Returns the pixel color at screen coordinates x, y at memory address "base"

void leave_graphics ( __dpmi_meminfo  map  ) 

Unmap video memory, disable near pointer and returns to text mode

void set_pixel ( int  x,
int  y,
int  color,
char *  base 
)

Draws a pixel of color "color" at screen coordinates x, y at memory address "base"

Variable Documentation

int HRES

global variable with the horizontal resolution in pixels

int VRES

global variable with the vertical resolution in pixels
